newsitem.title: FRANCE: Varig to increase ex-Paris cargo rates Apr 1.
newsitem.headline: Varig to increase ex-Paris cargo rates Apr 1.

text.p: Brazilian airline, Varig, said it will increase its ex-Paris cargo rates by an average of eight percent, effective April 1.
Varig operates a five pallet-capacity DC10 aircraft on a daily passenger route from Paris/CDG to Sao Paulo and Rio.
Varig increased its ex-Paris cargo rates by a similar amount in October 1996.
"The rate increases reflect buoyant demand on routes from Europe to Brazil and South America as a whole," a Varig cargo oficial told Reuters.

The official added: "We have been trying to negotiate extra air cargo capacity from Paris and while the airline has in principal agreed to this, we have no firm date yet on when a bigger aircraft, probably an MD11 PAX, might be introduced."
Varig Paris cargo office also trucks freight to Amsterdam and Frankfurt on a regular basis where it is transferred on to the airline's full-freighter services to Brazil.
- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
